page.title: 09Housing in Shenley
page.content: Houses in Shenley Church End (population 270) centre around the school and church and straggle behind high hedges down Oakhill Road. Mansell Close, named after the first rector, is a mid-war estate of 17 counci houses built of brick and recently modernized. Several individual houses run along the main road including the Dower House and the 18th century Manor Farm House, the occupants of which are building a stone cottage surrounding a swimming poolin part of their property. They recently found in the ceiling of the farm house a coin dated 1701. The 6 almshouses, now privately owned, were built in 1607 for 2 women & 4 men of 'honest conversation'. A mile to the south of Shenley Brook End (pop.210) consisting of 25 homes called 'Dovecote Cottages' several individual homes,small holdings,farms.
